summary: This document is an email chain from April 23, 2021, among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff and a contractor, coordinating the timing of a press release related to an arrest in a securities case. The discussion notes a desire to issue the release simultaneously with the SEC and mentions that timing after Ghislaine Maxwell's 2:30 PM arraignment would not get much attention.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as having an arraignment scheduled for 2:30 PM on the date of the email, with the note that any press release issued after that time would not get much attention.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's Arraignment
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled for arraignment at 2:30 PM.

events.title: Arrest in Securities Case
events.description: USPIS made an unexpectedly early arrest in a securities case; the defendant was to be presented in Florida the morning of April 23, 2021.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The email chain is dated April 23, 2021, and discusses coordinating a press release for an arrest in a securities case.
Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment was scheduled for 2:30 PM on April 23, 2021, and it was noted that any press release issued after that time would not get much public attention.
The arrest in the securities case was made by USPIS (United States Postal Inspection Service) and involved a defendant to be presented in Florida.

The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was working with the SEC (Securities and Exchange Commission) on a parallel complaint and wanted to issue a press release simultaneously.
The document includes references to attachments: a draft press release ('Franzone Arrest PR amg approved.docx') and a complaint ('21 MAG 4261 SEALE. 2021.04.19 Complaint Final.pdf').
